document.docAuthor: Ren, Lan-Lan, Stroiński, Adam & Qin, Dao-Zheng
document.docTitle: Ricanula fujianensis Ren, Stroiński & Qin, 2016, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Three new species of the genus Ricanula Melichar, 1898 (Hemiptera: Fulgoromorpha: Ricaniidae) from China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Three new species of the genus Ricanula Melichar, 1898 (Hemiptera: Fulgoromorpha: Ricaniidae) from China

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology. The species name is derived from the type locality, Fujian Province .

Diagnosis.
Ricanula fujianensis
sp. nov.
is similar to
R. pulverosa (Stål)
, but differs from the latter in having numerous yellowish transverse veinlets in inner half of tegmina (with few transverse veinlets on basal portion in
R. pulverosa
); ventral periandrium of the new species bearing a pair of processes (ear-like structure with almost transparent bar-like process beyond it), bending dorsal and oriented to phallic complex (ventral periandrium without processes in
R. pulverosa
); apical spinose processes of aedeagus long, surpassing half length of the phallic complex (apical spinose processes short, not reaching half length of the phallic complex in
R. pulverosa
).
Description . Length (inclu. teg.): male 8.7–9.8 mm , female 9.3–10.8 mm .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 18–23.
Ricanula fujianensis
sp. nov. ,
male. (18) habitus, dorsal view; (19) same, lateral view; (20) anterior part of body, dorsal view; (21) frons and clypeus, frontal view; (22) tegmen, dorsal view; (23) wing, dorsal view. Scale bars = 1 mm (Figs 18–23).

subSubSection.paragraph: Rostrum reaching mesotrochanters, apical segment shorter than subapical.
Thorax . Pronotum distinctly longer in midline than vertex; disc of pronotum with median carina, anterior and posterior margins arcuate, in median portion almost parallel ( Fig. 20 ).
Wings small, costal area present and small; postcostal cell distinctly longer than wide, 2 transverse veinlets r-m and m-cu present ( Fig. 22 ).

Pro- and mesofemora as long as pro- and mesotibia, both square in cross section; metafemur square, shorter than metatibiae, metatibiae partly flatted, with 2 lateral spines and 6 apical teeth; basitarsomere with 6~8 apical teeth, a little longer than cumulative length of second and hind tarsomere. Metatibiotarsal formula 2/6/6–8.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 24–30.
Ricanula fujianensis
sp. nov.
(24) male terminalia (without aedeagus), lateral view; (25) female terminalia, lateral view; (26) gonoplac, lateral view; (27) gonapophysis IX and gonospiculum bridge, lateral view; (28) gonopophysys VIII and endogonocoxal process, lateral view; (29) female anal tube, dorsal view; (30) male anal tube, dorsal view. Scale bars = 0.5 0 mm (Fig. 25); 0.20 mm (Figs 24, 26–30).

FIGURES 31–34.
Ricanula fujianensis
sp. nov.
(31) phallic complex, lateral view; (32) same, dorsal view; (33) same, ventral view; (34) pregenital sternite (female), flattened. Scale bars = 0.10 mm (Figs 31–34).

subSubSection.paragraph: Phallic complex . Phallic complex, in lateral view, broad and short, bent at middle; periandrium with lateral split longer than half of its length, lateral lobes present; periandrium, in dorsal view, longer than aedeagus, upper margin of dorsal periandrium divided in middle, lateral lobes slightly bent inside; in ventral view the upper of ventral margin with 2 ear-shaped lobes, the apical lobe bearing bar-shaped transparent process (in lateral and dorsal views), basal part of periandrium without any additional structures; dorsal periandrium shorter than ventral ( Figs 31–33 ).

Female terminalia . Pregenital sternite with lateral lobes well developed, median portion strongly narrow; anterior margin weakly concave medially; posterior margin straight with slightly convex median portion ( Fig. 34 ).

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Type material. Holotype ,
1♂ : [ China : Fujian , Wuyi mountain , Tongmucun ,
850 m
, coll. Manqiang Wang and Bin Xiao ,
16 Aug. 2008
].

subSubSection.paragraph:
Paratypes :
6♂♂ and 5♀♀ , same data as holotype
;
9♂♂ and 10♀♀ : [ Fujian , Sanming , Longxi mountain ,
725 m
, col. Fengjuan Ren ,
2 Aug. 2013
]
.
Distribution. China : Fujian Province .
